attributes.name: isolation_source
attributes.value: This genome was reconstructed from an aerobic pyrene degrading enrichment culture grown from soil-compost microcosms, as described in Adam I.K. et al., under review. An uncontaminated and unfertilized agricultural soil (Ap horizon of a Haplic Chernozem) of the Static Fertilization Experiment Bad Lauchstädt (Germany) was supplemented with mature compost (Bio-Komp SAS Gmbh, Weizenfels, Germany) for biostimulation; the compost consisted of a mixture of vegetable and animal organic waste. Two stable enrichment cultures (UC1 and UC10) capable of total pyrene (spiked at a concentration of 100 mg/L) mineralization were obtained from the microscosm and shotgun sequenced (see Adam I.K. et al., under review 2016).

biosample.isolation_source: This genome was reconstructed from an aerobic pyrene degrading enrichment culture grown from soil-compost microcosms, as described in Adam I.K. et al., under review. An uncontaminated and unfertilized agricultural soil (Ap horizon of a Haplic Chernozem) of the Static Fertilization Experiment Bad Lauchstädt (Germany) was supplemented with mature compost (Bio-Komp SAS Gmbh, Weizenfels, Germany) for biostimulation; the compost consisted of a mixture of vegetable and animal organic waste. Two stable enrichment cultures (UC1 and UC10) capable of total pyrene (spiked at a concentration of 100 mg/L) mineralization were obtained from the microscosm and shotgun sequenced (see Adam I.K. et al., under review 2016).
